intro: Anthospermum aromaticum, commonly known as the Indian balsam, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The leaves are lance-shaped and emit a distinctive fragrance when crushed, contributing to its common name.
